intro: Tiquilia ferreyrae, commonly known as the Ferreyra's tiquilia, is a small, flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in the spring, and it is often found in desert scrub or chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
